page.title: 01Ugthorpe Area near Whitby
page.content: Ugthorpe is a hamlet 10km west of Whitby surrounded by 50 to 100 acre farms mainly sheep and dairy herds with some beef. Fields are traditional hawthorn Hedged and small in size. The village has a population of about 350 with basic amenities. But two unusually fine churches, one c of e and one catholic. The southern and western edges of the village are exposed moorland at 200mts dotted with prehistoric tumili and monoliths. The landscape is undulating and within the national parks.
